greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n = Product_{k >= 1} (p_k)^(c_k) where p_k is k-th prime and c_k >= 0 then a(n) = Sum_{k >= 1} c_k*((-1)^(k-1)).
comment: Let p(n,x) be the completely additive polynomial-valued function such that p(1,x) = 0 and p(prime(n),x) = x^(n-1), like is defined in A206284 (although here we are not limited to just irreducible polynomials). Then a(n) is the value of the polynomial encoded in such a manner by n, when it is evaluated at x=-1. - The original definition rewritten and clarified by _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 03 2018
Positions of 0 give the values of n for which the polynomial p(n,x) is divisible by x+1. For related sequences, see the Mathematica section.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: Totally additive with a(p^e) = e * (-1)^(1+PrimePi(p)), where PrimePi(n) = A000720(n). - _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 03 2018
example: The sequence can be read from a list of the polynomials:
(The list runs through all the polynomials whose coefficients are nonnegative integers.)
program: (PARI) A195017(n) = { my(f); if(1==n, 0, f=factor(n); sum(i=1, #f~, f[i,2] * (-1)^(1+primepi(f[i,1])))); } \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 03 2018
xref: For other evaluation functions of such encoded polynomials, see A001222, A048675, A056239, A090880, A248663.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Feb 06 2012
ext: More terms, name changed and example-section edited by _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 03 2018
